briefdescription.para: Variable template for counting the occurrences of a specialization of a template type in a tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
Type
Template type to count occurrences for.
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
This variable template provides a compile-time constant for the count of occurrences of a specialization of a template type in a tuple.

briefdescription.para: Sorts and removes duplicate elements from a random access range.

detaileddescription.para: This function sorts the elements of the given random access range and removes duplicate elements, leaving only unique elements in the range.

parameterdescription.para: The random access range to be modified.

briefdescription.para: Appends a value to the range if it is not already present.

detaileddescription.para:
This function appends a value to the given random access range only if the value is not already present in the range. It returns the index of the value in the range, whether it was added or already existed.
T
The type of the value to be appended.
r
The random access range to be modified.
v
The value to be appended.
The index of the value in the range.

briefdescription.para: Prints the contents of a container to the specified output stream.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints the contents of the given container to the specified output stream.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the container to be printed.
The container whose contents will be printed.
The output stream where the contents will be printed. Default is std::cout.

briefdescription.para: Transforms a value range to a pointer range.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the container containing values.
The container whose values will be transformed to pointers.

simplesect.para: A subrange containing pointers to the values.

briefdescription.para: Transforms a pointer range to a reference range.

detaileddescription.para: This function transforms a range of pointers to a range of references.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the container containing pointers.
The container whose pointers will be transformed to references.

simplesect.para: A subrange containing references to the pointed objects.

briefdescription.para: Finds the index of the first element in the tuple satisfying a predicate.

detaileddescription.para:
Tuple
Type of the input tuple.
Predicate
Type of the predicate function.
tuple
Input tuple.
pred
Predicate function to check each element.
Index of the first element satisfying the predicate. If no element satisfies the predicate, it returns the size of the tuple.
This function takes a tuple and a predicate function and finds the index of the first element in the tuple that satisfies the given predicate. It uses Dune::Hybrid::forEach to iterate through the tuple.

briefdescription.para: Checks if none of the elements in the tuple satisfy a given predicate.

parameterdescription.para: Predicate function to check each element.

simplesect.para: bool True if none of the elements satisfy the predicate, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if any of the elements in the tuple satisfy a given predicate.

parameterdescription.para: Predicate function to check each element.

simplesect.para: bool True if any of the elements satisfy the predicate, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Filters the elements of a tuple based on a given predicate.

detaileddescription.para:
Tuple
Type of the input tuple.
Predicate
Type of the predicate function.
tuple
Input tuple.
pred
Predicate function to filter the elements.
auto Tuple containing elements that satisfy the predicate.
This function applies the given predicate to each element of the tuple. It constructs a new tuple containing only those elements for which the predicate returns true. The resulting tuple is returned.

briefdescription.para: Creates a tuple with unique types from the given tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
Types
Variadic template parameters representing types.
tuple
Input tuple.
auto Tuple with unique types.
This function takes a tuple and returns a new tuple containing only unique types from the input tuple.

briefdescription.para: Counts the number of elements in the tuple satisfying the given predicate.

detaileddescription.para:
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
Predicate
Predicate function determining whether an element satisfies the condition.
tuple
Input tuple.
pred
Predicate function.
constexpr size_t Number of elements satisfying the predicate.
This function counts the number of elements in the tuple that satisfy the given predicate.

briefdescription.para: Finds the index of the first element in the tuple that is a specialization of the given template type.

detaileddescription.para:
Type
Template type to search for.
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
Index of the first specialization in the tuple
This function finds the index of the first element in the tuple that is a specialization of the given template type. It returns the size of the tuple if the template type is not found

briefdescription.para: Gets the specialization of the given template type from the tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
Type
Template type to search for.
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
tuple
The tuple containing elements.
The specialization element
This function retrieves the specialization of a template type from the tuple.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a tuple has a specialization of a template type.

detaileddescription.para:
Type
Template type to check for.
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
true if the tuple has the specialization; otherwise, false.
This function checks if a tuple has a specialization of a template type. It uses find_if to search for the type and returns true if the index is less than the tuple size; otherwise, false.

briefdescription.para: Counts the occurrences of a specialization of a template type in a tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
Type
Template type to count occurrences for.
Tuple
Type of the tuple.
The count of occurrences of the specialization.
This function counts the occurrences of a specialization of a template type in a tuple.

briefdescription.para: Creates a subset tuple with the first N elements from the given tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
N
Number of elements in the subset.
Tuple
Type of the original tuple.
t
The original tuple.
A new tuple containing the first N elements of the original tuple.
This function creates a subset tuple with the first N elements from the given tuple.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new tuple using indices from the original tuple.

detaileddescription.para:
Tuple
Type of the original tuple.
I
Indices to include in the new tuple.
t
The original tuple.
A new tuple containing elements from the original tuple based on the specified indices.
This function creates a new tuple using indices from the original tuple. It uses makeTupleFromTupleIndicesImpl from the Impl namespace to implement the tuple creation.

briefdescription.para: Creates a flattened nested tuple.

parameterdescription.para: Types contained in the original tuple.

briefdescription.para: Creates a flattened nested tuple and stores references.

detaileddescription.para:
Tuple
Type of the original tuple.
tup
The original tuple.
A new tuple with stored references.
This function creates a flattened nested tuple and stores references.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference or std::nullopt if the object is a nullptr.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Fun &f, const autodiff::Wrt< Vars... > &wrt, const autodiff::At< Args... > &at, U &u, std::array< G, U::RowsAtCompileTime > &g, std::array< H, U::RowsAtCompileTime > &h)
memberdef.name: hessianN

briefdescription.para: Computes the Hessian matrix for each parameter of a given function.
The Hessian matrix represents the second-order partial derivatives of the function with respect to the specified variables.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the function to be differentiated.
The types of the variables with respect to which the Hessian is computed.
The types of the arguments passed to the function.
The type representing the result of the function evaluation.
The type representing the gradient of the function.
The type representing the Hessian matrix.
The variables with respect to which the Hessian is computed.
The values at which the Hessian is evaluated.
The result of the function evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Find a linear segment in a set of data points.

detaileddescription.para: his function is inspired by the MATLAB code at: https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/identify_linear_piece.m It is designed to find the most linear segment in a set of data points

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinates of the data points.
The y-coordinates of the data points.
The size of the line segment to be identified.

simplesect.para: A tuple containing the polynomial representing the identified line segment and the indices of the data points in the segment.

briefdescription.para: A function to obtain the global positions of the nodes of an element with Lagrangian basis.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the global nodal coordinate vector
Local view bounded to an element
A vector of global nodal coordinates to be updated

briefdescription.para: A helper function to obtain the global index from the global positions for a Lagrange node.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the global nodal coordinate vector

briefdescription.para: A function to obtain the local coordinates of subentities of an FiniteElement.

simplesect.para: view over the position of the subenties

briefdescription.para: A function to obtain the local coordinates the vertices of an FiniteElement.

memberdef.argsstring: (NonlinearOperator &nonLinOp, CheckFlags checkFlags=CheckFlags(), std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)> p_updateFunction=[](typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &a, const UpdateType &b) { a+=b;})
memberdef.name: checkGradient

param.type: std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)>

briefdescription.para: Checks the gradient of a nonlinear operator.

detaileddescription.para: The checkgradient function is inspired by http://sma.epfl.ch/~nboumal/book/ Chapter 4.8 and https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/checkdiff.m

simplesect.para: True if the check passed, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (NonlinearOperator &nonLinOp, CheckFlags checkFlags=CheckFlags(), std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)> p_updateFunction=[](typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &a, const UpdateType &b) { a+=b;})
memberdef.name: checkJacobian

param.type: std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)>

briefdescription.para: Checks the Jacobian of a nonlinear operator.

detaileddescription.para: The checkjacobian function is inspired by http://sma.epfl.ch/~nboumal/book/ Chapter 4.8 and https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/checkdiff.m

simplesect.para: True if the check passed, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (NonlinearOperator &nonLinOp, CheckFlags checkFlags=CheckFlags(), std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)> p_updateFunction=[](typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &a, const UpdateType &b) { a+=b;})
memberdef.name: checkHessian

param.type: std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)>

briefdescription.para: Checks the Hessian of a nonlinear operator.

detaileddescription.para: The checkHessian function is inspired by http://sma.epfl.ch/~nboumal/book/ Chapter 6.8 and https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/checkhessian.m

simplesect.para: True if the check passed, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Ref< const Eigen::VectorXd > &x, const Eigen::Ref< const Eigen::VectorXd > &y, int deg)
memberdef.name: polyfit

briefdescription.para: Fits a polynomial of a given degree to the given data points.

parameterdescription.para: The degree of the polynomial to fit.

simplesect.para: std::tuple<Dune::Functions::Polynomial<double>, double> A tuple containing the fitted polynomial and the least square error.

briefdescription.para: A function which loops over all the nodes of a tree and performs different actions for a power node (with leaf node as child) and a leaf node depending on the corresponding functor passed.

detaileddescription.para: This function is inspired from the function Dune::TypeTree::Detail::forEachNode available in dune/typetree/traversal.hh

parameterdescription.para: Type of the functor called for a power node.
Type of the functor called for a leaf node.
Tree whose nodes are to be looped over.
The tree path which handles index values.
A functor to be called for a power node.
A functor to be called for a leaf node.

briefdescription.para: A helper function that helps in traversing over the local coordinates of an element and call a user-desired function.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the global nodal coordinate vector
Type of the functor that traverses over the local coordinate of an element
Local view bounded to an element
A function that traverses over the local coordinate of an element
